answers.answer: I don't know, but I am right there with ya. :( I'm 30 weeks, stressful job on my feet, long days, no breaks 5 days a week and have class the other two.... As long as you're going to the doctor/midwife as you should be then you should be fine if they haven't said anything. You can always bring it up to your doctor if you want a little extra close attention/check up because you're concerned.... As for the pains, if they are "expected" pains, back, feet, etc, then no worries. But anything to severe, or unusual and I would call or even go get checked out... My back/feet/knees hurt like crazy all the time, I started to think maybe I should take my 12 weeks of FMLA leave early and rest before baby gets here, just save two or three weeks to heal after birth, lol. But then again I can really only afford to take six weeks off and want those for time with baby. :) .... Try to rest and feel better. (and good luck with the mother in law, mine lives a 1000 miles away and I'm fine with that, lol).

Well I don't work but I can completely relate with you on the whole stress thing, I've been very stressed through this pregnancy. It definitely isn't good for baby when mom is stressed, but from what I read there are no long term affects to baby. With that being said you really need to try to relax your body physically and emotionally. ... It's not good for YOU. You need to be a healthy mommy for your little angel. You should speak with your boss and request a break and as for your mil let her know nicely she needs to get your input before doing anything for baby. Good luck and best wishes!

Yes u have to be very careful. Stress can definitely cause premature labor. It can also cause a lot of complications. Where do u live that they don't give u breaks at work? It's illegal in the state of Michigan. My 1st pregnancy I had a miscarriage. I had a high level job stressful & a lot of lifting. I say be safe.

I done some light reading about stress during pregnancy and it really is jot good for you or your baby. It can cause low birth weight. And it's also been said that high stress during pregnancy can possible cause emotional problems down the line for the babies. But like I said, I only did light reading on the matter so you may want to look further into it. I wish you lots of luck! Every mom to be should be able to enjoy their pregnancy to their the fullest drama/stress free.
How can you legally not get a lunch or a break? I would be calling hr and going on short term disability to get some of the pay. Get on wic for food.

Yes, stress can affect your unborn baby... you can go into labor prematurely and be put on bed rest... stress also elevates blood pressure which can lead to preeclampsia-- not a condition I (or anybody else) wants to deal with... as far as no breaks/lunches... get a doctor's note stating the necessity of breaks/lunches given your medical condition... if they refuse its a violation of the ADA (Americans with Disabilities Act)

Thank you ladies, this has helped me a lot and I will ask about short term disability in the morning. I work at Petsmart, and work the floor, so constantly walking around and climbing ladders and picking up things for people.I had just woke up with horrible cramps and dull back pain and have also been having bowel movements every hour so I hope that doesn't mean anything bad :/
Arent there labor laws against not providing breaks.....especially considering you are pregnant. I would check into that.

I was told I have to go to them and ask them for breaks. I've tried a few times, they end up saying oh wait till the next associate comes in to cover with you. Which by then my 9 hour shift will have been over -__- its very frustrating. I'm hypoglycemic too.

Call hr. Legally, they cannot deny you a break. If they don't have enough associates on the floor, they need to schedule more. Legally, you should have a break about every two to three hours. No lunch after 6 hours should be flagged anyway. Hr can walk you through what to do.

question: I'm 33 weeks. I have been stressing a whole lot lately, and work full time. I'm constantly on my feet, and never get more then a few hours of sleep if even. I have a mother n law who is always stressing me by trying to do the baby things her way without my input, and my work doesn't give me breaks or even a lunch. I'm exhausted and tired :( I'm afraid of going into premature labor or stressing too hard and hurting my baby.. Can stress or hard work really cause bad things to happen? I don't want to lose my baby :'( I'm constantly in pain but can't quit work due to I have to pay bills.
title: just need some advice :(
